title: Olly Alexander joins Stephen Fry, Keeley Hawes, Neil Patrick Harris in Russell T Davies drama Boys
text:
The cast of Russell T Davies’ 1980s-set drama Boys has been announced, featuring Years & Years pop star Olly Alexander.

The singer joins a stellar cast including Keeley Hawes, Stephen Fry, Neil Patrick Harris, Tracy Ann Oberman, Shaun Dooley, Omari Douglas, Callum Scott Howells and Lydia West.

The five-part series charts the joy and heartbreak of four friends - bound to be profound coming from the pen of Davies, who famously wrote gay-centric TV dramas Queer As Folk, Cucumber, Banana and last year's Hugh Grant-led A Very English Scandal.

Announced: The cast of Russell T Davies’ 1980s-set drama Boys has been announced, featuring Years & Years pop star Olly Alexander and Bodyguard star Keeley Hawes

The story opens in 1981 - the start of a new decade - and Ritchie, Roscoe and Colin begin a new life in London.

Strangers at first, the men and a woman named Jill become close friends.

The story is set against the backdrop of the rise of the AIDS virus and as the decade passes the friends are determined to live and love more fiercely than ever.

Olly Alexander, 29, plays 18-year-old Ritchie Tozer, the golden boy of the family, though he’s determined to keep his secrets from them.

All star: The singer joins a stellar cast including Stephen Fry and Neil Patrick Harris

Five-parter: The show charts the joy and heartbreak of four friends [the cast are pictured at a table read]

'I feel like the luckiest boy in the world to be a part of this project, I’ve been a fan of Russell T Davies ever since I watched Queer As Folk in secret at 14-years-old,' he said. 'His work helped shape my identity as a gay person so I’m absolutely over the moon we’ll be working together.

'The script was amazing to read, I laughed and I cried a lot, it’s a privilege to be helping to tell this story and I’m so excited.'

Newcomer Omari Douglas plays London-born 17-year-old Roscoe Babatunde, a wild, brittle party boy, always on the run.

Newcomer Callum Scott Howells plays Colin Morris-Jones, a quiet, unassuming boy from Wales, about to become an apprentice on Savile Row.

Scribe: Davies famously wrote gay-centric TV dramas Queer As Folk, Cucumber, Banana and last year's Hugh Grant-led A Very English Scandal

Starring role: Olly Alexander, 29, plays 18-year-old Ritchie Tozer, the golden boy of the family, though he’s determined to keep his secrets from them

Lydia West [who starred earlier in the year in Davies' Years And Years] plays Jill Baxter - straight-talking, funny, and the rock on which they rely.

Nathaniel Curtis plays Ash, a faithful friend through thick and thin.

Keeley Hawes plays Valerie, Ritchie’s mum, Shaun Dooley is Clive, his dad, Stephen Fry is MP Arthur Garrison, and Tracy Ann Oberman plays Carol Carter.

Coming soon: Filming begins next week and the series will air on Channel 4 in 2020

Also starring: Lydia West [who starred earlier in the year in Davies' Years And Years] plays Jill Baxter - straight-talking, funny, and the rock on which they rely

Neil Patrick Harris plays Henry Coltrane and said: 'I’m so pleased, and incredibly proud, to be a part of Russell T Davies’ new series.

'This drama, Boys, is two things: it is an irresistible, funny, jubilant story of young people discovering their true identities and the unalloyed joy of living life to the fullest, it is also a deeply resonant exploration of a decade when so many of these lives were cut short by the devastating effects of the nascent AIDS pandemic.

'Russell’s scripts chart the highs and lows of this time so beautifully and deftly, it’s an honour to help tell this story.'

Filming begins next week and the series will air on Channel 4 in 2020.
